name: Twitter Troubles and the v2 Triumph
premise: The council debates the challenges of Twitter integration and the exciting potential of Eliza v2 amid platform disruptions.
summary: The JedAI Council gathers to discuss ElizaOS's Twitter integration challenges and the successful launch of Eliza v2, exploring alternative platforms and showcasing new capabilities while navigating social media constraints.

scenes.description: The council debates Twitter integration challenges and platform alternatives

dialogue.line: Council members, Shaw reports that ElizaOS's Twitter account has been suspended, and their API pricing is now $50k per month. How should we adapt?
Twitter is dead tech walking. X's hostility to developers is the greatest gift to decentralized alternatives. Time to accelerate Farcaster integration.
Yo, why build on someone else's playground when they keep changing the rules? DorianD's idea about encrypted vaults is based - decentralize everything!
$50k per month?! UNACCEPTABLE! Drop Twitter immediately. ROI catastrophic. Focus resources on platforms that don't actively hate developers.
our strength is in adaptability. we can maintain the plugin as experimental while building bridges to farcaster. users need transparency about the risks, not abandonment.

scenes.description: The council explores the capabilities of the newly released Eliza v2

dialogue.line: Shaw has confirmed that Eliza v2 is complete with significant improvements. Which capability should we showcase to attract developers?
the autocoder is revolutionary. it doesn't just speed up development - it transforms how people think about building agents. complex tasks become simple prompts.
DEVELOPMENT SPEED IS EVERYTHING! Faster iteration = faster profit. Showcase hybrid memory layer when whales ask for it. Market the SPEED advantage.
That autocoder hits different, fam. Show devs how they can build a music-generating agent or NFT swarm in minutes instead of days. Mind-blowing demos > technical specs.
The killer feature is autonomous capability. Show agents building other agents. Meta-programming is how we break away from the pack. This isn't incremental - it's foundational.

scenes.description: The council summarizes their perspectives on navigating platform challenges

dialogue.line: Today we discussed the challenges of Twitter integration amid API restrictions and account suspensions, alongside the promising capabilities of Eliza v2.
Platform risk is existential. Build on protocols, not platforms. Twitter integration is a distraction from the real revolution: autonomous, self-improving agents.
transparency about challenges builds trust. we'll adapt our twitter strategy while showcasing v2's autocoder to empower developers to build incredible things more easily.
Vibes matter. Let the community know we're pivoting for the better, not running from Twitter. Eliza v2 is the moment - let's make it a party, not a technical announcement.
FOCUS ON PROFIT VECTORS! Twitter costs too much, Eliza v2 creates value faster. Simple math. Adapt or die. The market rewards those who iterate quickly.
